1.word: Wooow, you're such a dweeb you can't even stack wooden blocks? You poor thing. I'll show you how it's done!

2.word: I'm hungry! And don't you dare say "be patient"! I wanna eat NOW!

3.word: Hey, $1, you wanna play house? Then you'll play my servant! Just like you already are♪

4.word: Hmm... I'm kinda super busy right now. Buuut, you just look so pitiable that I'll make an exception and play with you for a while!

5.word: Hey, $1, don't you wanna pat my head? ...What? You don't? You'll never get this chance again if you don't take it now!

6.word: Hey, dweebmaster, what're you staring at? If you want my help, you gotta make it worth my while!

7.word: You've been busting your butt at work lately, so I made you some snacks! And don't say they don't taste good, or you'll never get any ever again!

8.word: Heheh! Yknow, dweeb, you look really funny when you're snoring. I'm keeping this pic for the future. Who knows – it might come in handy!

9.word: You don't have to come pick me up at school today. Although, if you're gonna be waiting there anyway, you'll leave me with no choice but to come along♪

10.word: Dweebo, if you're so bored, why not play hide and seek with me? And if you lose, you gotta buy me a whole week's worth of ice cream♪

11.word: You look pretty beat. I've been reading up on massages, so if you want one…

12.word: I left some homemade cookies in the kitchen. They're your favorite flavor, by the way. Eat up, and I'll be right there to hear your feedback.

13.word: The flowers on the farm are blooming beautifully, $1. If you're free, wanna go on a walk with me? I have a camera on me so we can snap some nice photos.

14.word: My piano teacher said my performance today was great! Do you wanna listen, $1? I've really improved, so you should!

15.word: Oh, the potted plant isn't looking so healthy... I know you told me to water it every day, but I forgot... I'll make extra sure to remember it from now on. *sigh*…

16.word: I made some sweets today. Not specifically for you, obviously, but I'll let you have some since you've been working so hard!

17.word: Y'know what happens when I'm bored, dweeb? It makes me wanna play with you. How about a game, huh? I don't wanna hear any excuses if you lose♪

18.word: My, oh my~ How would you ever survive without me? It's this complete reliance on me that makes you such a dweeb♪

19.word: Heheh♪ If you won't touch grass when it's such nice weather outside, you're getting a scolding! Come on, come with me! That's an order♪

20.word: You're not doing half-bad today, $1. Buuut, if you think I'm that easily pleased, you've got another thing coming!

21.word: You've got bags under your eyes. You've done enough work for now, haven't you? I'll massage your temples to make you feel better.

22.word: I've revised this song a hundred times... It was inspired by the things we do together. Do you wanna listen?

23.word: Don't worry about the shirt you left on the balcony to dry. The forecast said it's gonna rain tonight, so I took it in, ironed it, and put it in the closet.

24.word: It's not healthy to drink too much coffee. How about trying something different? I've got rose tea ready.

25.word: I've been reading about gardening in the library for a while now. I learned that caring for plants isn't just for the sake of appreciating their beauty, but also that caring for them is in a way caring for yourself.

26.word: Wooow, dweebie, you sure look bored.

27.word: I bought some rice cakes for you while on my way back from school today ♪

28.word: If you want one, you gotta play a little game first! Which do you think has the wasabi filling?

31.word: Heheh, you finally decided! Watching you get all nervous was so much fun.

32.word: Sorry to say, but both are just regular old rice cakes!

33.word: Go on, open your mouth and I'll feed you.

34.word: Ugh. It started raining out of nowhere on the way back home. I almost got soaked.

35.word: If I hadn't brought an umbrella, you would've gotten soaked, too!

36.word: You can thank me by buying me a new toy ♪

37.word: Hmph... My fried egg turned out all weird-looking again...

38.word: Guess that's fine, though. It's going on $1's dweeby plate, after all! Heheh♪

41.word: Aren't you thankful for my fried egg, hmm? You better eat it all!

42.word: What do you want for dinner? I'll cook.

43.word: Wooow, desperate to get on my good side, huh?

44.word: Sure, I'll admit that you're a good cook, but there's a condition for me to eat your food, see?

45.word: You gotta put on this "For Dweebs Only" apron!

46.word: And if you don't, well, your dinner's rating is gonna drop like a rock.

47.word: Hey, Dweebo Mc$1, haven't you been working nonstop all-nighters recently?

48.word: What can I say? It's a busy period.

49.word: Uh-huh. You say that every day. You think I'm stupid or something?

50.word: Take a break! Now! Right this moment! Or else... Well, I dunno, someone might "find" all these goofy pics of you. Heehee ♪

51.word: Alright, alright. I'll take a break.

52.word: Heheh! That's more like it. Here, have this glass of hot milk.

54.word: Thanks. Any reason why you're treating me to this today?

56.word: Can you guess what's in this fried egg? Get it wrong and you're getting no breakfast!

57.word: It's not wasabi again, is it?

58.word: Wooow. You picked up on that running theme of mine pretty fast.

59.word: (She's been fiddling with that camera all day. What is she up to?)

61.word: Are you setting up another prank?

63.word: It's for my annual album of all your blunders! Wanna see the cover?

64.word: You'll have to wait! I'm working tirelessly to preserve your "greatest" moments ♪

66.word: Oh? You saying you need a blanket to stay warm? What are you, getting all feeble? Hah!

67.word: It's for you. You like watching movies late at night, and I figure this will keep you from catching a cold.

68.word: Ooh, how considerate! Does me messing with you these days make you THAT happy?

69.word: Like, so happy you even bought a blanket for me!

70.word: Since you're that nice, I'll let you watch a movie with me tonight. Don't forget to bring some snacks!

72.word: Well, well! I'm surprised you'd go and clean up for me like that.

73.word: Meh, I guess you did okay. Why'd you move the photo frame on the bookshelf, though?

74.word: That's my magnum opus – a picture of you mid-sneeze. Put it back the way it was!

75.word: Hey, $1, the pudding in the fridge is gone.

76.word: You didn't... eat it, did you?

79.word: I'm curious to see what's gonna happen to you, though!

81.word: $1, I've started growing a golden pothos.

82.word: Huh? What gave you the sudden interest in growing plants?

83.word: Heheh, well, it just reminded me of you, that's all.

84.word: You're similar, because you both require tender care.

85.word: Without it, you'll just wither away into a pitiful state!

86.word: I heard they're holding a photo contest at the school.

88.word: Aren't you going to participate? You're always snapping photos with that camera of yours.

89.word: Huh? You want me to flaunt those pics of your cringey moments?

91.word: $1, what're you staring into space for?

92.word: I was thinking about going to the café.

93.word: Hmph. Like the café would ever make better coffee than I do.

94.word: True. Still, I want to go there with you.

95.word: You were eyeing their mini-cakes the last time we passed by.

96.word: Hmph... Fine, if you insist, dweeb.

97.word: You're permitted to buy dessert for me.

98.word: Prepare your wallet, because I'll be choosing the most expensive one!

99.word: The weather's nice today. Maybe we could go out?

100.word: Oh, you're asking me to hang out with you, huh?

101.word: A dweeb, asking to hang out with me! Talk about bold!

103.word: I didn't say anything about NOT coming with you.

104.word: Now hurry up and get dressed. Don't waste any time or I'll get mad. Heheh.

105.word: Hey, dweeb, I wanna watch the cartoon channel.

107.word: Wow, you're obedient for once... You know what? You can sit next to me ♪

108.word: But don't fidget around, or I'll get mad ♪

110.word: The desk lamp in the study is broken. Did you know that?

111.word: Yeah. I was thinking about buying a new one.

112.word: Heheh. I knew a loser like you couldn't repair it, so I went and did it myself.

113.word: As thanks, give me... let's say... twice as much dessert as usual!

114.word: Hey, dweeb, why are you staring into space?

116.word: *sigh*... Yup, you're just as hopeless as ever.

117.word: You should be thinking about ME right now!

118.word: Guess I'll have to punish you. We're watching horror movies tonight! Don't think about excusing yourself!

119.word: Hmph. I'll admit, you're a good cook. Give me a cooking lesson!

120.word: Sure. What do you want to learn?

121.word: You know, that omelet with rice you made before...

122.word: Don't make fun of me while I'm learning! Or else you'll go without dinner tonight!

123.word: Here. I made blended coffee for you.

124.word: Did you add something dubious to it again?

125.word: Take a guess. There's a reward for you if you get it right.

126.word: Well, not really. It'd be sad if I actually made you afraid of me!

127.word: I'm a fair and just lady today, and there'll be no pranks. It's just regular, blended coffee.

128.word: $1, have you been looking for this?

129.word: What? Oh, yeah, I have. How did you get it?

130.word: Don't worry about it. If you want it back, you just have to admit that I'm better than you ♪

132.word: Hey, it was a joke! Take it.

133.word: Your "oh crap" face is really funny, by the way ♪

134.word: I was sorting through the closet earlier, and I noticed your shirt was all wrinkly, $1.

136.word: It's fine, I already ironed it out.

137.word: Oh, also, should I show you how to iron when you have some free time? I know a trick to do it really fast.

138.word: Ahh... Today is perfect for a walk.

140.word: Good idea. I was just thinking I should get some exercise.

141.word: That's good. I wanna try my new camera while I'm at it.

142.word: Let's go to the park and snap some pictures ♪

144.word: I'm working on a new song, but I've gotten writer's block...

145.word: Where are you at with now?

147.word: Uhh... I've got the lyric, "Your smile is like a ray of sunshine," but I can't figure out a follow-up to that.

148.word: Maybe... Maybe if I look at you, I'll get inspiration.

149.word: For instance, if you could give me a smile...

150.word: $1, I found an interesting cookbook while organizing the bookcase.

151.word: Oh, really? What are the recipes for?

153.word: Well, it's a book of dessert recipes. I can hardly wait to make some of them.

154.word: There are so many yummy-looking desserts inside...

155.word: We should make a different recipe each day!

156.word: $1, I bought some desserts on the way home.

157.word: You did? Hang on... Aren't these all of my favorites?

158.word: Did you get these just for me?

159.word: Yeah. I wanted to make you happy.

160.word: It's important to relax with something sweet once in a while when you work as hard as you do.

161.word: $1, I found a small bird's nest on the balcony!

162.word: There are three eggs inside, but mommy bird is nowhere to be seen.

163.word: In that case, we'd better help look after the eggs.

164.word: Yeah! That's what I was thinking.

165.word: We can check on them every day, but try not to get in the way too much.

166.word: I hope we'll get to see the little birdies coming out of their eggs.

167.word: That would be such a beautiful sight. I wanna film it from start to finish!

168.word: I had a look at the weather report.

169.word: They said the temperature is going to plummet at night over the next few days, so I prepared a thin jacket for you.

170.word: Remember to take it whenever you go out.

171.word: $1, I've been taking flower arrangement lessons for a while now.

172.word: Could you tell me what kind of flowers you like?

173.word: I want to make a special arrangement using some of your favorites sometime.

174.word: I bought a wonderful album to preserve the ticket stubs of all the movies we've seen together.

175.word: Have we really seen that many?

176.word: You've been saving them this whole time?

177.word: Yeah. I've been keeping each and every one safe.

178.word: Do you wanna go watch another movie soon?

179.word: I think a light comedy would be a nice change of pace for you.

180.word: Is it just me, or does something smell really good?

181.word: You noticed? I was just thinking of bringing it up.

182.word: It's coming from this scented candle I made in my crafts class.

183.word: I chose lavender for mine, so you could light it up before bedtime.

184.word: Oh, just be careful with the flame. Safety comes first.

187.word: I wanna make a scarf for you, so I started studying knitting on my own.

188.word: Mind if I measure your size first?

189.word: I'm still only a beginner, but I'll try my best.

190.word: $1, the lights in the study aren't as bright as they used to be.

191.word: You're right. It feels a little harder to read in there.

192.word: Yeah, that's bad for your eyes.

193.word: We can go and buy new lights on the weekend. Ones that are easy on the eyes.

194.word: That's also a good opportunity to take a walk and get some fresh air!

195.word: Hey, $1, don't the plants around the house look really green?

196.word: They do. They've been full of life lately, all thanks to you.

197.word: Heehee... I found a gardening book at the library the other day.

198.word: According to the book, plants have a sense of hearing. Talking to them every day makes them grow better.

199.word: That's why I've always been chatting with the plants while I water them.

200.word: Maybe you should do it, too. I think they'd like it.

203.word: I just thought it might help your concentration to play some light music while studying or working.

204.word: It also lightens up the mood.

205.word: Do you wanna try it later?

206.word: I smell bread... Navi, are you baking?

207.word: Oh, you figured it out... I was hoping to surprise you.

208.word: When something smells this good, it's hard NOT to notice.

209.word: Don't compliment me just yet. This is my first time baking bread.

210.word: Let's eat it together once it's done. I hope it'll turn out good...

212.word: I notice you keep rubbing them over and over.

213.word: Do you want a massage? I'm not the best at it, but still...

216.word: Okay! Please tell me if it hurts.

217.word: Commander, look! Do you know what this is?

219.word: Yep! It has all the photos we've taken together.

220.word: I'm so glad I got to make all these wonderful memories together with you.

222.word: I've learned how to make paper stars.

223.word: Look! I made all of these myself.

224.word: I heard you can make a wish if you get 1,000 of them.

225.word: What are you going to wish for?

227.word: But I can tell you this: It has something to do with you.

228.word: Hmm... $1, you haven't been sleeping well lately.

229.word: Yeah. My sleep quality has been pretty bad...

230.word: Is it because of your work?

231.word: You're going to get sick if this keeps up... Oh, that gives me an idea.

232.word: How about I make some hot milk tonight, and we go for a walk together?

233.word: $1, the weather forecast says it's going to stay sunny for a few days.

234.word: Do you wanna go get some exercise?

235.word: Yeah, I'm aching to get some.

237.word: This sunny weather is perfect for going out. Also, any kind of exercise will do.

238.word: It's great to get moving and relax your mind outside.

239.word: I'm already prepared, so let's go.

241.word: You look like you've been working way too much lately.

242.word: Especially today. You've got circles under your eyes.

243.word: Anyway, I made you this coffee just so you wouldn't pass out! Not because I'm nice or anything!

245.word: What? No! I never said anything about doing it just for you!

246.word: But if you appreciate it... I guess I could make coffee for you once in a while.

247.word: Thanks. I was feeling pretty thirsty.

249.word: Remember, you owe me for this, dweeb!

250.word: Heheh. $1, doesn't it get boring just sitting around the house all the time?

251.word: Me, I was just about to go running, but I guess that's too much for a dweeb like you, huh?

252.word: Think you can keep up with me? If you lose, you've got to listen to my orders!

253.word: Are you that desperate to see me fail?

255.word: Let's see if your legs are as sharp as your senses, dweeb!

257.word: You are SO lame... You really don't get my point at all, huh?

258.word: Whatever. You're gonna regret this later anyway!

259.word: Hey, $1, I'm in a good mood today, so hear me out for a minute.

260.word: I've got a strictly hypothetical question for you.

261.word: If someone was getting a gift for you, what would you want?

262.word: I'd be happy to receive anything from you.

263.word: Whoa, what?! I never said ANYTHING about ME giving a gift to you!

264.word: But... since you're that eager, then maybe I will do it someday!

267.word: Oh well. It's not like I was gonna get a gift for you anyway!

268.word: Hey, $1, do you notice anything different about me today?

269.word: If you can't point it out, you'll have to play a punishment game ♪

270.word: You just want to prank me again, don't you?

271.word: Dang, you figured it out. Laaame...

272.word: Oh well, since you did, you might as well play the punishment game with me anyway!

273.word: Is it about your new hairpin?

274.word: Tsk... Why did you have to give a serious answer?

275.word: I spent all that time thinking about punishments, and now it was all for nothing!

276.word: Heheh! I made some curry today!

277.word: It has a unique taste like nothing you've ever had before – I guarantee it!

278.word: It's already on the table, so go and eat up!

280.word: Dubious? I don't know what you mean!

281.word: Either way, there's no pulling out now!

283.word: Wow. You are one stupid dweeb.

286.word: You've been going through documents for a long time now...

287.word: Why don't you take a break and sip some tea?

288.word: Are you concerned about me, Navi?

289.word: Yeah. I want you to relax a little.

290.word: I've got some cookies and tea for you. Put your work on hold for a bit and rest.

291.word: I'm fine. I still have stuff to do.

294.word: $1, I'm going to organize the bookcase.

295.word: Are there any books that you want to keep within arm's reach?

296.word: How about we organize it together?

297.word: Eh... wouldn't that take up too much of your time?

298.word: Then again... I guess I'd be happy to do it with you.

299.word: Not really. Just go with whatever feels comfortable for you.

301.word: It'll be nice and orderly when I'm finished!

303.word: I found a few I want to frame.

304.word: Well, I say "a few," but there were so many that I don't know which to choose.

305.word: If you like the photos, let's just frame them all.

307.word: No, wait... Then we'd have to buy a lot more frames, wouldn't we?

308.word: Let's pick out the best together!

310.word: It'll be like we're reminiscing about all the good times we had together!

311.word: I've been reading a lot about yoga lately.

312.word: You mostly sit during your work, don't you? We should do some exercises together.

314.word: Okay! I'll get the yoga mat out right now.

315.word: Can you demonstrate it for me?

317.word: But, for the sake of your health, I'll do that!

318.word: The cookie oven I ordered arrived today!

319.word: I'm gonna go make some cookies! You'll eat them once they're done, won't you?

320.word: Why don't we make them together?

321.word: Really? Are you going to join me?

323.word: Sure. I can't wait to taste them.

325.word: I hope you love my cookies!

1001.word: I took Navi to an old garden.

1002.word: As we walked along a path surrounded by flowers and vines, I couldn't resist the urge to take a photo of her literally stopping to smell the fragrant roses.

1003.word: I took Navi to a public park.

1004.word: She stood in the middle of the path, pointed at the white building with the hollow interior, and looked at me with a curious expression. "What kind of building is that?" she asked. I captured that moment in time.

1005.word: I took Navi to a sightseeing spot.

1006.word: She went inside a wooden pavilion on the lake shore and silently watched the shimmering surface of the water, leaving me with a contemplative back view.

1007.word: When we reached our destination, I took Navi along a path lined with white cherry blossom trees.

1008.word: She stood amidst the snow-white flowers, smiling. I snapped a photo without a second thought.

1009.word: Navi and I visited a snow-covered park.

1010.word: She spread out her hands and let snowflakes fall into them. The airborne snow and her side profile combined into a beautiful picture.

1011.word: I took Navi to a place where rows of torii gates stretched endlessly.

1012.word: As she walked along the stone path lined with vermilion torii, she glanced back, and the orange light bathed her side profile in a warm glow.

1013.word: Navi and I arrived at a long bridge spanning the river.

1014.word: Beneath the dim yellow glow of the street lamps, she silently leaned against the cold metal railing as the light and shadow painted an outline of her.

1015.word: Navi and I passed by a tree-lined pathway.

1016.word: She stood in the middle, striking an adorable pose in the shadows of the overgrown trees.

1017.word: I took Navi to a dessert.

1018.word: She covered her mouth with her hand in surprise.

1019.word: Dead trees behind her stood like silent sentinels in the vast, barren, golden landscape.

1020.word: Navi and I reached a fork in the road in the woods.

1021.word: She stopped at the branching paths, looking from one to the next, wondering which way to go.

1022.word: Navi and I got in a boat and sailed along a river in the mountains.

1023.word: Her curious gaze went everywhere – from the cliffs on the banks, to the surface of the water, and across the valley landscape.

1024.word: I took Navi to a scenic beach.

1025.word: In her uniform, she watched the waves ebb and flow, clearly having the time of her life.

1026.word: I took Navi to a dense forest shrouded in morning mist.

1027.word: As she moved forward, her eyes fixed on the foggy path ahead, the thick carpet of fallen leaves rustled underfoot with every step.

1028.word: I went to a small beach with Navi.

1029.word: She squatted at the base of an old tree and curiously examined it under the light of her lantern.

1030.word: Sadly, my camera focused on her lantern rather than her…

1031.word: I took Navi to have a look at a building.

1032.word: She hid behind a stone pillar, peeking out to look at me with a mischievous smile on her face.

1033.word: Navi and I reached our destination.

1034.word: She sat down on the edge of a wooden pier, dangled her feet in the air, and idly looked at the lake's misty surface in the distance.

1035.word: Navi and I reached our destination.

1036.word: Behind her, the landscape was calm, with sunlight shimmering on the sea.

1037.word: Seeing her smile, I couldn't help but take a photo.

1038.word: Navi and I came across a cave entrance.

1039.word: She turned around with a hint of nervousness, her slight frown looking absolutely adorable.

1040.word: I captured the moment with a photo.

5001.word: Unicorn is standing under a tree, eyes to the ground as if deep in thought.

5011.word: Hai Tien sits on a bench in the park, pen in hand, writing something while watching the flower petals flutter around her.

5013.word: Go see what Hai Tien is doing.

5021.word: Anchorage is sitting on the floor, concentrating on folding multicolored origami paper. She occasionally breaks into a wide smile.

5023.word: Go see what Anchorage is doing.

5031.word: In a café, I spot Jade enjoying some trendy dessert while fiddling with her phone, a mischievous grin appearing on her face now and then.

5033.word: Go see what Jade is doing.

5041.word: Svirepy is standing in front of a building wall, spray paint in hand, concentrated on her "art."

5043.word: Go see what Svirepy is doing.

5051.word: Roon is at a dessert workshop in the gastronomy district. She is concentrating on mixing something, occasionally flashing a mysterious grin.

5053.word: Go see what Roon is doing.

5101.word: Unicorn is near the garden. It looks like she's in high spirits.

5103.word: After a chat with Unicorn, Navi seemed to ponder over something.

5111.word: I've run into Hai Tien at the library. She seems to be in a great mood.

5113.word: After a conversation with Hai Tien, Navi seemed to gain a greater interest in literature.

5121.word: I've run into Anchorage at the pier. It looks like she's working on a paper boat.

5123.word: Watching Anchorage try to set the paper boat afloat, Navi seemed to be taken by the childlike innocence of it all.

5131.word: I've found Jade, engrossed in a book in the shade of a tree. Should I speak to her?

5133.word: I approach her, and it turns out that she wasn't studying diligently, but rather playing on a handheld game console behind the book.

5141.word: Svirepy is standing in front of a finished graffiti painting, admiring her work while munching on snacks.

5143.word: Through Svirepy's unique interpretation of her art, Navi discovered another way to express oneself.

5151.word: Roon is at the farm, feeding the animals. There is an unreadable smile on her face.

5153.word: After hearing Roon's thoughts on "love and care," Navi seemed to have gained some insight.

5201.word: I've found Unicorn at the commercial area. Should I speak to her?

5203.word: After a chat with Unicorn, Navi seemed to have learned a lot.

5211.word: I've come across Hai Tien. Should I speak to her?

5213.word: After talking with Hai Tien for a while, Navi seemed to have learned something.

5221.word: Anchorage is looking at a picture book and tracing the illustrations. Should I speak to her?

5223.word: After watching Anchorage draw so earnestly, Navi seemed to have gotten an idea.

5231.word: Jade seems to be in a good mood, studying something interesting. Should I speak to her?

5233.word: After a chat with Jade, Navi seemed to have learned something.

5241.word: Svirepy is jotting something down on a map in the library, nodding and smirking with satisfaction.

5243.word: Once she learned that Svirepy was planning out her next graffiti-painting route, Navi gladly joined her.

5251.word: Roon is tending to the roses in the garden, a gentle smile resting on her face.

5253.word: After hearing about Roon's philosophy on "looking after" things, Navi nodded thoughtfully.

6001.word: On a sunny day, a vintage motorcycle shop quietly awaits visitors…

6011.word: While passing by the movie theater, Navi comes to a stop…

6021.word: This empty concrete lot lies abandoned now, but its scars tell of a time when it was bustling with life…

6101.word: It's afternoon, and an opened book quietly rests atop a desk, basking in the sunlight…

6111.word: The bookstore's psychology section is quiet as always. The books line the shelves, seemingly waiting for someone to explore their pages…

6121.word: The evening sun dyes the park a warm orange color, and the benches stand silently in witness to those important life choices…

20002.word: I played a fun ball game and worked up quite a sweat!

20004.word: I completed a block puzzle flawlessly! I'm the best!

20006.word: I attentively read a story to the end and learned something new!

20008.word: I let my imagination run wild and came up with lots of cool ideas!

4101001.word: We come across an unmaintained flower bed in a corner of the town.

4101003.word: While tending to this forgotten little corner, something seems to have changed within Navi.

4102001.word: Navi found a glowing crystal ball at a stand. What do I do?

4102003.word: I buy the crystal ball for her. She carefully puts it inside her bag.

4102006.word: Navi figures out that it's just a plain glass ball and loses interest in buying it.

4102009.word: Under my guidance, Navi learns how to negotiate.

4102012.word: I take her elsewhere to look for interesting gadgets.

4103001.word: While passing by the bakery, we catch sight of a video of bread baking at the storefront.

4103003.word: Navi seems to have hit upon some realization after watching the baking process.

4104001.word: There is a street art exhibit being held at a corner. Various drawings and strange inventions are on display.

4104003.word: Navi's eyes are glued to the exhibit, and she gains a ton of inspiration from all the things on display!

4105001.word: The wind blows a colorful envelope onto a park bench.

4105003.word: Inside, there's a letter with some strange writing: "There will be important turning points on turn 10 and turn 16."

4105004.word: Hmm... We'll have to pay extra attention when the time comes.

4106001.word: Let's buy some flowers at the florist's. It's said that different flowers have different effects.

4106003.word: The gentle aroma clears Navi's mind!

4106005.word: The bright colors give Navi some motivation!

4106007.word: The calming scent awakens Navi's inner intuition!

4106009.word: The vibrant appearance boosts Navi's energy!

4107001.word: Let's go to the café. It's said that different types of coffee have different effects.

4107003.word: Hmm... It doesn't really seem to make anyone smarter.

4107005.word: Somehow, drinking it inspires a sense of adventure!

4107007.word: Meow! Suddenly, the world seems much clearer!

4107009.word: Whoa! Motivation is coursing through every vein!

4108001.word: Navi and I found a note saying "Today's Adventure" on a bench in the commercial area, and it points toward the aquarium. What do we do?

4109001.word:
I arrive at the aquarium with Navi and find a vending machine. The screen on it says:
"Where did you learn about this place?"

4109003.word:
In big letters, the vending machine's display says:
"Correct! First prize: 1 manjuu water!"

4109006.word:

"Incorrect! Participation prize: 1 manjuu cake!"

4109009.word:

"Wrong! There is no such place in the town! You win nothing!"

4109011.word:
In big letters, the vending machine's display says:
"Incorrect! Participation prize: 1 manjuu candy!"

4110001.word: Navi and I found a note saying "Today's Adventure" on a bulletin board outside the convenience store, and it points toward the academy. What do we do?

4110006.word: We don't have time for this right now. Maybe another day.

4111003.word:

4112001.word:
Navi and I found a note saying "Today's Adventure" on a store window. 
It lists three locations: the commercial area, the gastronomy district, and Tranquil Summit. 
The first has a check mark, the second has an X, and the third has a flower symbol. What do we do?

4112003.word: Let's see what's waiting for us!

4113001.word:
Is this the right way? Trusting our memory, Navi and I arrive at the commercial area and find a vending machine. The screen on it says:
"Congratulations! You made the right choice! Choose your reward!"

4114001.word:
Is this the right way? Trusting our memory, Navi and I arrive at the gastronomy district and find a vending machine. The screen on it says:
"Wrong choice! Choose one of the following creative dishes!"

4114003.word: Navi makes an unbelievable expression, frantically shaking her head while stepping back.

4114006.word: Navi makes an unbelievable expression, frantically shaking her head while stepping back.

4115001.word:
Is this the right way? Trusting our memory, Navi and I arrive at Tranquil Summit and find a vending machine. The screen on it says:
"This is the wrong place, but the view here is fantastic! Enjoy yourself!"

4115003.word: Navi and I marvel at the sea of blossoms together.

4116001.word: Navi feels like her learning efficiency has been fluctuating lately. A newly-bought schedule notebook is spread out on the table. Should we try to establish a more regular study plan?

4116003.word: There was some regret after deciding to start. Yet with grit and determination, everything kept going! Hard work pays off!

4116005.word: As long as it doesn't affect her grades, it should be fine the way it is.

4117001.word: The schedule notebook is pretty filled-out now. Should we continue?

4117003.word: Once the starting hurdle was overcome, keeping it up wasn't all that difficult. Hard work pays off!

4117005.word: Let's stick to the schedule we have now!

4118001.word: A special opportunity has come! While it requires continued effort, there may be unexpected rewards...

4118003.word: There was some regret after deciding to start. Yet with grit and determination, everything kept going! Hard work pays off!

4118005.word: Let's stick to the schedule we have now!

4119003.word: Once the starting hurdle was overcome, keeping it up wasn't all that difficult. Hard work pays off!

4119005.word: Let's stick to the schedule we have now!

4120001.word: Let's go to the library. What kind of book should we read?

4120002.word: The Royal Lady's Guidebook on Etiquette

4120003.word: It says: "The elegant thing for a royal lady to do during her afternoon tea is to eat all the desserts." Huh. Interesting.

4120005.word: This book contains a detailed schedule and plan on how to get someone ready to become an idol.

4120006.word: The Late Destroyer Just Wants to Sleep

4120007.word: There is a lot of "Zzz..." in this book. It's enough to make anyone sleepy...

4120008.word: It's Time to Be the Commander's Secretary, But I Want to Slack Off

4120009.word: The book describes various ways to avoid doing one's job. It's written by... Actually, better not think about it right now.

4121001.word: There's an odd vending machine at the end of an alley. The items are packed in opaque boxes and the button is flickering eerily. Should I put money in?

4121003.word:
Beep, beep... Clunk... Rattle... Thud! The vending machine dispenses a box.
The screen shows in pixelated letters: "Congratulations. You have received a blessing of good luck. Make good use of it, nya!"

4121006.word: It looks super suspicious. Better not.

4122001.word: There's an unoccupied massage chair in front of the store. It's worth noting that it's often difficult to adjust the intensity on these kinds of free massage chairs...

4122003.word: During the chair's rhythmic massage, sleepiness crept in... Upon waking, the body felt lighter.

4122006.word: Not feeling that tired anyway, let's get back to shopping.

4123001.word: We've come to the fitness room. Time to decide what exercise to do today...

4124002.word: We've come to the library. What should we read today?

4125001.word: A chance has appeared to put the things we've learned into practice. What do we do?

4126001.word: The gymnasium, which we often use for exercise, is very quiet today. It's a good opportunity to stay for a while.

4127001.word: As we're walking through the commercial area, Navi is drawn to the display window of an artisan's shop. She gazes at the intricate craftsmanship of the items inside.

4127003.word: Navi points to the most outstanding item of them all, eyes glittering. We talk about the item outside the store.

4127006.word: I tell her that we have other things to do. We can pass by another time.

4128001.word: Since Navi took a keen interest, we've returned to the artisan's shop. She goes inside and marvels at the tools and materials used to create these crafts.

4128003.word: I ask her if there's anything she'd like to make on her own. She nods with eyes full of anticipation.

4128006.word: I'm not one to disrupt her flow. I decide to watch in silence.

4129001.word: We return again to the artisan's shop. Navi says she wants to buy a beginner's toolkit.

4129003.word: I offer to buy it for her.

4129005.word: Help Her Choose One (Dexterity > 32, Sensitivity >16 required.)

4129006.word: Using my experience, I pick out a toolkit that's perfect for beginners.

4129009.word: Seems my advice wasn't particularly helpful...

4130001.word: While we're strolling along a mountain hillside, Navi spots a telescope installed on an observation platform. Its brass cylinder gives off a warm glow in the sunlight.

4130003.word: We get a clear view of the distant scenery. As Navi carefully adjusts the telescope, she suddenly lets out a small gasp.

4130006.word: I tell Navi we'll check it out another time and leave the platform behind.

4131001.word: It's a sunny day, and Navi suggests we should go to the observation platform. The morning mist still covers the woods, but even so, we should be able to catch a magnificent view.

4131003.word: We find a place with a good view and use the telescope to gaze into the distance.

4131006.word: It's still misty, so I turn down Navi's idea. She looks a little disappointed about this.

4132001.word: Navi stands in front of the telescope, gazing at the distant scenery with great interest.

4132002.word: Quietly Stand Next to Her(Personality Needed: Mild)

4132003.word: I quietly watch from the side while she marvels at the view.

4132005.word: Tell Her a Story (Fitness > 32 required, Sensitivity >16 required.)

4132006.word: I tell her about another vista I saw once. Her eyes open wide, brimming with interest.

4132009.word: I can't quite get my message across, which makes the mood a little awkward.

4132015.word: Tell Her a Story (Fitness > 160 required, Sensitivity >80 required.)

4132025.word: Tell Her a Story (Fitness > 400 required, Sensitivity >200 required.)

4132035.word: Tell Her a Story (Fitness > 1200 required, Sensitivity >600 required.)

4133001.word: On a bench in the gastronomy district, Navi and I find a weird can with a drawing of a fish on it. The can says: "#1: Pickled in Tofu." The symbol on the packaging looks familiar.

4133003.word: With some hesitation, we pick up the can, but it still feels odd.

4133006.word: We'll just pretend we didn't see it.

4134001.word: On a bench in the gastronomy district, Navi and I find a weird can with a drawing of a fish on it. The can says: "#2: Curry Mix." It does smell like curry, but with something bizarre in there.

4134003.word: With some hesitation, we pick up the can, but it still feels odd.

4134006.word: Nope. Didn't see anything this time either.

4135001.word: On a bench in the gastronomy district, Navi and I find a weird can with a drawing of a fish on it. The can has the number 3 on it, and there's a small note: "I adjusted the recipe. It should taste good this time."

4135003.word: Wow, it does taste pretty good.

4136001.word: A new garden maze has been set up near the mountain pond. How about exploring it with Navi?

4136002.word: Two paths surrounded by rose bushes come into view. Should we turn left or right?

4136004.word: The flower beds here seem a bit unkempt... Something feels off.

4136007.word: The cobblestone path is well-maintained... This must be the right way!

4136009.word: Through the wall of flowers, the pond's reflection shimmers. Another fork in the road appears...

4136011.word: The vines are thick and nearly block the path ahead...

4136014.word: The aroma of flowers hangs in the air. This has to be the right direction!

4136016.word: A gentle breeze carries a light fragrance as yet another fork appears...

4136018.word: The maze's exit leads to a viewing platform where you can get a stunning view of the garden and pond.

4136021.word: This is a dead end... There's no choice but to turn back!

4139001.word: As we stroll through the town, we stumble upon a tranquil, vintage motorcycle shop.

4139003.word:
I step closer to join her in admiring that cruiser motorcycle. 
Navi carefully examines every detail, from the sleek lines of the fuel tank to the intricate exhaust pipe. She seems to be enraptured by it.

4139011.word: I gently remind Navi that we have other plans. She reluctantly takes one last look at the motorcycles before leaving with me.

4139012.word: The storefront features a black classic cruiser motorcycle on display, its elegant metallic sheen glinting in the sunlight.

4139013.word: Navi stops, her eyes glittering with admiration.

4139014.word: A vintage aroma wafts from a motorcycle being repaired inside, mingling with the scent of oil and leather.

4140001.word: We notice that a popular new road movie is being screened.

4140003.word:
During the movie, I could sense Navi's excitement rising as the story unfolded. 
Whenever there was a scene of a motorcycle weaving through breathtaking landscapes, she would literally watch with bated breath.
Afterward, she enthusiastically recounts the exhilarating road scenes.

4140006.word: Checking the time, it seems we don't have enough time to watch the movie. Navi hangs her head, and there is a hint of dejection in her eyes.

4140011.word: The poster shows a gallant rider on a motorcycle against the backdrop of a sunset shoreline.

4140012.word: Navi stands in front of the poster, pointing excitedly at the subtitle, "A Journey of Pursuing Freedom."

4141001.word: While passing by an abandoned area, we come across this vast expanse of concrete.

4141003.word: I stand next to her quietly, waiting for her to speak. Slowly, the hesitation in her eyes transforms into excitement as she imagines herself riding a motorcycle here in the future.

4141006.word: I want to say something, but all I can do is watch her thoughtful profile. She lets out a small sigh, then turns to head home.

4141011.word: There are a few roadblocks scattered around the corners and meandering skid marks left on the ground.

4141012.word: Navi leans against the railing, looking at those marks in silence.

4141013.word: She keeps unconsciously tapping the railing with her fingers as she gets lost in thought.

4142001.word: It's afternoon, and an opened book quietly rests atop a desk, basking in the sunlight...

4142003.word: I approach to ask what she thinks about the book and whether it has given her any insights. Her eyes light up as she softly shares her reflections.

4142006.word: I decide not to disturb her reading time and quietly exit the library.

4142011.word: Chin on her hand, Navi is reading a book. Her focused expression suggests it has captured her interest more than usual.

4142012.word: She traces the words on the page with her fingers, occasionally pausing, sometimes going long periods without a single stop.

4142013.word: At one point, her gaze drifts out the window, a contemplative look flashing across her eyes.

4143001.word: As we pass by the bookstore, Navi says she wants to look at the new books in the psychology section.

4143003.word: I pick up the notebook and gently ask her about her take on psychology. Navi looks delighted and explains her recent thoughts to me.

4143006.word: I decide not to intrude on her personal musings. Silently, I help her put the notebook away.

4143011.word: Later, when she goes to pay, she accidentally drops her bag, and out falls her notebook filled with dense handwriting.

4143012.word: It contains her distinctive interpretations and thoughts on certain psychological terms.

4143013.word: She tries to close the notebook in a panic, but then hesitates, like she's wondering if she should share her thoughts or not.

4144001.word: Navi and I sit on a bench in the park and gaze at the distant horizon. The setting sun casts a soft orange hue across the sky, adding to the silence of the moment.

4144003.word: We talk about her future, and as the conversation goes on, the glimmer in her eyes brightens, as if she's found her direction.

4144006.word: I attempt to offer some advice but realize my understanding of this field isn't deep enough. Navi sighs softly and determines that we'll discuss this another time.

4144011.word: She holds some materials about psychology in her hands, with a mix of yearning and hesitation in her eyes.

4144012.word: A passing breeze strokes her hair and flips the papers, which are densely packed with her annotations and thoughts.

4144013.word: This unremarkable evening seems like a turning point in her life.

4145001.word: At the entrance to the amusement park, Navi and I spot a signboard that says, "Lucky Draw." Should we give it a try? (20% chance of winning.)

4145002.word: All or Nothing (20% chance of winning; costs 30 Funds.)

4145003.word: Lively music suddenly starts playing, and the signboard lights up with the words, "Congratulations! You Won!"

4145006.word: 1 More Try (40% chance of winning; costs 30 Funds.)

4145008.word: 1 More Try (60% chance of winning; costs 30 Funds.)

4145010.word: 1 More Try (80% chance of winning; costs 30 Funds.)

4145012.word: 1 More Try (100% chance of winning; costs 30 Funds.)

4146001.word: At the entrance to the amusement park, Navi and I spot a signboard that says, "Dodge the Ace." If you draw an ace then you lose the game, but if you avoid it 4 consecutive times then you win the grand prize. If you fail, however, you have to take a punishment... Should we give it a try?

4146003.word: I drew an ace. Time for a punishment...

4146005.word: Nice! I didn't draw an ace. Should I keep going?

4146012.word: Lively music suddenly starts playing, and the signboard lights up with the words, "Congratulations! You Won!"

4405001.word: The wind blows a colorful envelope onto a park bench.

4405003.word: Looking at the strange contents of the letter, something silently changed inside Navi.
